title: Sri Lanka President to invite opposition to a new cabinet: Keheliya
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s President Gotabaya Rajapaksa is likely to invite opposition members to the cabinet following the mass resignation of his ministers as street protests were staged against energy shortages and high inflation coming from two years of money printing.
Ruling party member Dinesh Gunewardena said late Sunday that the entire cabinet had given their resignations to Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa to discuss with President and take the next steps.

“What will happen next is the President will invite the opposition and offer certain portfolios in the next cabinet as the opposition has said they would have done something differently had they been in power,” Keheliya Ramukwelle who held the health portfolio said.
“Since the parliament sessions are on Tuesday, the key cabinet appointments are likely tomorrow.”
Eleven constituent parties of Gotabaya Rajapaksa’s ruling coalition called for a caretaker or interim government.

Opposition legislator Harsha de Silva had said their party would be not support a government with the 20th amendment to the constitution since it had led to autocratic decisions and the current crisis.
Large crowds attempted to storm President Gotabaya Rajapaksas residence last week and curfews were imposed under emergency rule on Saturday ahead of planned street protests on Sunday.
However members of the public and the opposition defied curfews to protest and called for the resignation of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa.  (Colombo/Apr04/2022)
